title.label: Excellent game, but learn from my mistake!

content.label:
Kingdom Rush is one of my favorite tower defense series and one of my favorite iOS games ever. When I started playing Frontiers, I was having a blast until I switched out of the app to check something else on my phone, only to find all my current game progress lost. Close to 30 minutes of progress, and I was kicked back to the title screen!

But after doing some digging, I learned the trick: make sure low power mode is turned OFF and that you have Background Refresh for Frontiers turned ON. No issues since then. Probably a rookie mistake on my part, but I was just glad I could get back to enjoying what’s a phenomenal tower defense game. Enjoy!
This is one of those games you just enjoy playing. It is well worth whatever the price is. :)
The game for a dollar is not that great and is portrayed in many other free apps of this kind

title.label: One Of The Greatest Games Of All Time

content.label: I’ve played this game when I was in middle school and I play it still when I’m out of school

title.label: The best mobile game I have ever played, going 5 years strong.

content.label: This game is the best mobile game I will probably ever play. The graphics are amazing and the gameplay is so engaging, especially for a tower defense game. Everything is outstanding, and replayability makes it worth the cost. However, compared to Origins and the first Kingdom Rush, this game is INCREDIBLY DIFFICULT, and the last level with the final boss on iron veteran difficulty took me almost a year to beat, (albeit me being a kid at the time) and don’t even get me started on Dusk Chateau. This game is super addictive, fun and engaging, and at the same time provides a good challenge and great incentive to continue to play. Please play this game. You’ll enjoy it. I have to five entire years, so I think you can trust me. :)

I am a huge fan of IronHide games and this is my favorite kingdom rush iteration. It has great art, (so do the others but this is my favorite), a great story, great tower builds and great landscapes as well as achievements. However I have some tiny complaints, mainly around the achievement Mua'Dib, which is just infuriating because of the necessity of troops because of dune terrors and reinforcements can't deal with all of them and you can't maneuver them so you must use barracks and have to be on constant lookout even if you are being overwhelmed by immortals and desert thugs, which incidently can be dealed with easier by reinforcements, which we established can't be used. Eeeerrgg😅 The other issues is miner and relates to difficulty scaling in veteran mode with heroic and iron challenges. But either way it is a great game. Thanks IronHide Games for yet another great game.🙃

For those who love a good TD like me but don’t want to wait an entire minute just watching the enemies walk through the level each round, don’t spend the $1. Looked on the forums and people suggested using a cheat mod to speed it up but I’m not into that so. Bought it, played a few levels on brutal and beat them pretty easily but goodness each round takes forever.
A great continuation, well worth every cent if you liked the first

So I’m playing a great round and everything is going great. I exit the game mid way in a level to take a break. When I open the game again it runs through the normal intro but only now the level I was progressing through has now reset. Why!?!
Just an enjoyable game. Easy to understand, not overly complicated.
Great series!! Wish they came out with a new one

I also love that you pay for the game up front and they don’t force you to buy a bunch of IAPs to advance. I bought some of the additional characters just to support the devs. Ironhide feels like one of the few honest devs out there. Keep it up!

The best tower defense games on iOS get better with new levels. Ironhide Studios is my favorite iOS game developer, not only do they offer high quality games, but they keep giving us awesome new content years after game release. Kingdom Rush is my favorite game series, and Ironhide is the standard by which developers should be measured. Buy some heroes (in app purchases which are not necessary to enjoy the game progression, but increase your enjoyment) to show support for a developer worthy of patronage.

title.label: Great! It’s like an expansion of the original.

content.label: Frontiers is the second game in the Kingdom Rush series, it builds upon the original in a good way. It takes the brutal strategy of the original and simplifies it slightly making all the challenges hard but fair. Frontiers introduces new towers and heroes leading to different strategies, but the heroes and advanced towers from the original are not present so options are limited. The difficulty curve of the game is much improved over the original, that being said both games can be made much easier by changing the difficulty or use of the items bought from the gem shop, best of all gem can be earned for free in this game so if you need a little boost it’s available. In short Frontiers is a great follow up to the original, it introduces new challenges and the gem shop along with new towers and heroes, and the game can be just as hard as the original.
